alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 08 at 3:10AM MDT until May 09 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MONDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE EASTERN PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Windy conditions will return across the Northeast Highlands today with gusts potentially reaching 35 mph. In addition, another dry day is expected with humidity plummeting in the afternoon, leading to critical conditions in the Northeast Highlands. Another round of critical fire weather conditions are possible on Tuesday across the Northeast Highlands before becoming more widespread and more extreme on Wednesday due to an approaching Pacific low and associated front. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (123) from noon to 8 pm MDT Monday, Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to near 35 mph today and Tuesday. South-southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to near 50 mph on Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent today and Tuesday. 10 to 15 percent on Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and these Fire Weather Watches.
